newsitem.title: USA: Century, Bank Corp revise merger terms.
newsitem.headline: Century, Bank Corp revise merger terms.

text.p: Century South Banks Inc and Bank Corp of Georgia have entered a new merger agreement, revising terms of a deal announced previously, the companies said on Tuesday.

Under the definitive agreement, Bank Corp of Georgia shareholders will receive 1.33 shares of Century South stock for each share of Bank Corp stock they own, instead of 1.4 shares of Century South stock, as announced on March 17.
The change is the result of a computational error in the calculation of Bank Corp's fully diluted shares, the Georgia-based companies said.
Century South shares rose 1 to 19-3/4 early Tuesday afternoon. Bank Corp shares closed Monday at 24-5/8.
